UGtastic’s most recent interviews are with Martin Atkins, Jonathan Baltz, and J.C. Grubbs. – Find out more about the people behind user-groups, meetups and technical conferences. Run a meetup or user-group then signup to get your community featured today.

  • Original URL: http://ugtastic.com:80/
  • Snapshot timestamp: 2012-12-03 20:09:04 UTC

Archive Snapshot

UGtastic Interviews Groups Blog Participate Become a sponsor Suggest a group Sign In Sign In
Remember me Forgot your password?   Guest Martin Atkins Welcome To the User-Group Industry. You're
Going To Have a Good Time. Martin Atkins is an artist, teacher, author and musician who’s uniquely
open to new experiences. He started out as a drummer in bands like Public Image Limited and has had
a broad career of collaborations notably (for yours truly) with bands like NIN and Ministry. Most
recently he’s also published several books on surviving the music industry and has presented on the
music industry at conferences like Madison Ruby and ChicagoWebConf and has been sharing his
experiences running a successful Kickstarter Campaign. Let’s just say he’s a very busy fellow and
has some good thoughts that we should take the time to listen to. I’m very excited about this
interview and consider it a high point in my interviewing career. :) BTW, a Ministry tape was the
first piece of real musical rebellion I had squashed by my mom way back when I was a teenager, so
this is also a bit of a fan crush getting to speak with someone who helped create some of the music
I still enjoy. Make blackberry jam. Sponsored by ChicagoWebConf Interviewed on 2012-10-06 by Michael
D. Hall | Published on 2012-12-02 | permalink   Guest Jonathan Baltz The Force of Sales Jonathan
Baltz runs the Chicago Heroku and Chicago Force.com Developers user-groups. We discuss the
differences and similarities between the types of people who gravitate to the two different
meetings. Sponsored by ChicagoWebConf Interviewed on 2012-10-06 by Michael D. Hall | Published on
2012-11-28 | permalink   Guest J.C. Grubbs Chicago's Web Conference JC Grubbs is one of the lead
organizers of ChicagoWebConf conference and the CEO of DevMyndSoftware. ChicagoWebConf was founded
to fill the gap between developer focused and designer focused conferences. Sponsored by
ChicagoWebConf Interviewed on 2012-10-06 by Michael D. Hall | Published on 2012-11-25 | permalink  
Guest Melissa Castello Learning About Interviewing Melissa Castello is a trained, professional
interviewer who’s worked interviewing people in the professional poker and horse racing circuits.
She’s gotten a chance to travel all over and hone her interviewing skills in sometimes high-pressure
situations. Sponsored by ChicagoWebConf Interviewed on 2012-10-06 by Michael D. Hall | Published on
2012-11-21 | permalink   Guest Kumar McMillan From the People That Helped Make the Web Open, Mozilla
Might Do the Same for Mobile Phones Kumar McMillian works for the Mozilla Foundation for the team
working to create the Mozilla OS. Kumar talks a bit about working with large, distributed teams with
many volunteers collaborating with paid engineers to create a potential competitor to the Android
and iOS phone operating systems. Kumar also helps run the online radio station ChirpRadio. Sponsored
by ChicagoWebConf Interviewed on 2012-10-06 by Michael D. Hall | Published on 2012-11-18 | permalink
1 2 3 4 5 … Next › Last » UGtastic grew from the belief that interacting with people for a few
minutes can convey more or different ideas than blogs and twitter. Based on that idea, we aim to
collect a a series of short interviews with individuals who run user-groups, meetups, tech
conferences or are otherwise involved in supporting technical communities. If any of the above
applies to you, or you're engaged in fun software related things like running large F/OSS projects,
speaking at conferences, or simply feel that yours is a unique perspective on technical communities,
we should have a chat! Drop a note here to set up an interview or let us know what you are working
on and how we can help. We'd love a chance to learn something together. Published Interviews Welcome
To the User-Group Industry. You're Going To Have a Good Time. Martin Atkins The Force of Sales
